meanings.definition: A type of tree with large, lobed leaves and distinctive bark.
meanings.sent1: The sycamores in the park provide shade on hot days.
meanings.sent2: I love the way sycamores look in the fall with their colorful leaves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played hide-and-seek among the sycamores.
meanings.sent4: The sycamores stood tall like guardians of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The rustling of the sycamores in the wind was a soothing lullaby.

meanings.definition: Plural form of sycamore, referring to multiple trees of this type.
meanings.sent1: We had a picnic under the shade of the sycamores.
meanings.sent2: The sycamores along the riverbank create a beautiful natural canopy.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the sycamores were a secret hideout.
meanings.sent4: The sycamores lined the path like a row of ancient sentinels.
meanings.sent5: The rustling leaves of the sycamores whispered secrets to the wind.
